description: My professor got me into it a few years ago, and I wondered were it had been all of my life
summary: Great app, use it for grad school

description:
JabRef 
- does all the work a reference manager should be doing
- can get bibtex data from dois, isbns,... great!
- can organise references into various groups
- and comes with a very responsive open source development community
summary: Great app, customizable, simple to use

description: As far as I can tell, it is the best FOSS reference manager out there. Definitely better than KBibTex. Nice looking, modern UI, and it fetches references for you based on DOI, ISBN etc. I just don't get why it needs to eat up so much memory, 600+ MB is quite a lot for such an application.
summary: Best FOSS tool for the job

description: Everything works as expected except when I have it on my secondary monitor. I cannot open the context menu (left click) if it is not on my primary monitor.
summary: Good but some multi monitor issues
